item.title: Dec-2025 Quarterly Earnings Reveal Mixed Trends Across Market Caps
item.description: The December 2025 quarterly earnings season has concluded with 4,095 companies reporting results, revealing a nuanced picture of corporate performance across market capitalisations. While the overall proportion of companies delivering positive results has improved marginally to 46.0%, mid-cap firms continue to lead the charge with a 53.0% positivity rate, outpacing large caps which lag at 43.0%. This article analyses the key trends, sectoral highlights, and standout performers shaping the current earnings landscape. Time: 7 minutes ago

item.title: Loyal Equipments Falls 8.23%: Technical Stabilisation and Valuation Shift Mark the Week
item.description: Loyal Equipments Ltd experienced a challenging week, with its stock price declining by 8.23% from Rs.178.00 to Rs.163.35 between 16 and 20 February 2026, underperforming the Sensex which gained 0.39% over the same period. The week was marked by a cautious upgrade in the company’s rating to 'Sell' amid persistent financial headwinds, alongside a shift in valuation metrics that rendered the stock more attractive despite ongoing market pressure. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: Galaxy Surfactants Gains 3.62%: 3 Key Factors Driving the Weekly Move
item.description: Galaxy Surfactants Ltd recorded a 3.62% gain over the week ending 20 February 2026, outperforming the Sensex’s modest 0.39% rise. The stock showed strong momentum early in the week, hitting an intraday high of Rs.2,048.50 on 17 February before retreating amid mixed technical signals and valuation concerns. This review analyses the key events shaping the stock’s performance and the implications for investors. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: W S Industries Falls 1.81%: 3 Key Factors Driving the Weekly Decline
item.description: W S Industries (India) Ltd closed the week at ₹73.76, down 1.81% from the previous Friday’s close of ₹75.12, underperforming the Sensex which gained 0.39% over the same period. The week was marked by a notable upgrade in the company’s quality parameters, a shift to bearish technical momentum, and a significant valuation reassessment, all contributing to a complex market sentiment around the stock. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: Indergiri Finance Surges 17.02% Amid Mixed Fundamentals and Technical Shifts
item.description: Indergiri Finance Ltd delivered a robust weekly gain of 17.02%, closing at Rs.27.50 on 20 February 2026, significantly outperforming the Sensex’s modest 0.39% rise over the same period. The stock’s trajectory was marked by sharp daily advances, despite persistent fundamental challenges and mixed technical signals. This review analyses the key events and market dynamics that shaped the stock’s volatile week. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: Praj Industries Gains 0.70%: 4 Key Factors Driving This Week's Volatility
item.description: Praj Industries Ltd closed the week with a modest gain of 0.70%, slightly outperforming the Sensex’s 0.39% rise. The stock experienced significant intraday volatility, driven by a downgrade in its quality and mojo grades, a sharp rebound on 17 February, and a marked shift in valuation metrics amid mixed market conditions. Despite the week ending near its opening price, the stock’s trading activity and fundamental reassessments highlight a complex outlook for investors navigating this industrial manufacturing player’s near-term prospects. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: Asian Hotels (East) Ltd Gains 6.17%: Downgrade and Mixed Signals Shape the Week
item.description: Asian Hotels (East) Ltd delivered a notable weekly gain of 6.17%, closing at Rs.159.25 on 20 February 2026, outperforming the Sensex which rose a modest 0.39% over the same period. The week was marked by a significant downgrade in the company’s quality grade and rating to Strong Sell, reflecting deteriorating fundamentals and bearish technical signals. Despite these headwinds, the stock showed resilience with a sharp rally midweek, followed by mixed price movements aligned with sector and market trends. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: HMT Ltd Gains 10.32%: 3 Key Factors Driving the Week’s Surge
item.description: HMT Ltd delivered a strong weekly performance, rising 10.32% from ₹43.50 to ₹47.99 between 16 and 20 February 2026, significantly outperforming the Sensex’s modest 0.39% gain. The stock’s rally was marked by two consecutive days hitting the upper circuit limit, reflecting intense buying momentum despite the company’s prevailing Strong Sell rating and mixed technical indicators. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: eClerx Services Ltd Falls 3.00%: Valuation Reset and Market Volatility Shape Week
item.description: eClerx Services Ltd experienced a challenging week on the bourses, closing down 3.00% from ₹3,666.85 on 13 Feb 2026 to ₹3,556.75 on 20 Feb 2026, while the Sensex gained 0.39% over the same period. Despite the stock’s underperformance relative to the benchmark, the week was marked by a significant upgrade to a Strong Buy rating by MarketsMOJO, driven by improved valuation metrics and robust financial fundamentals. The juxtaposition of a rating upgrade amid price weakness reflects a nuanced market response to valuation shifts and sector dynamics. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: S I Capital & Financial Services Ltd Gains 15.94%: 2 Key Factors Driving the Move
item.description: S I Capital & Financial Services Ltd delivered a robust weekly performance, surging 15.94% from ₹34.00 to ₹39.42 between 16 and 20 February 2026, significantly outperforming the Sensex’s modest 0.39% gain. This rally was underpinned by a notable shift in valuation perceptions and a technical upgrade, despite ongoing financial challenges and a cautious market outlook. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: Symphony Ltd Falls 5.45%: 2 Key Factors Behind the Weekly Decline
item.description: Symphony Ltd’s shares declined by 5.45% over the week ending 20 Feb 2026, closing at Rs.828.65 compared to Rs.876.40 the previous Friday. This underperformance contrasted with the Sensex’s modest 0.39% gain during the same period, reflecting a challenging week marked by a shift to bearish technical momentum and the stock hitting a fresh 52-week low amid subdued financial results and valuation concerns. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: City Union Bank Ltd. Dips 0.91% Despite Bullish Upgrade and Technical Momentum
item.description: City Union Bank Ltd. closed the week at ₹281.80, down 0.91% from the previous Friday’s close of ₹284.40, underperforming the Sensex which gained 0.39% over the same period. The week was marked by a significant upgrade to a 'Buy' rating by MarketsMOJO, driven by strong financials and a shift to bullish technical momentum, although the stock faced some profit-taking towards the end of the week amid mixed technical signals. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: PVV Infra Ltd Falls 4.46%: Valuation Shift and Mixed Signals Shape Weekly Performance
item.description: PVV Infra Ltd’s share price declined by 4.46% over the week ending 20 February 2026, closing at Rs.4.93 from Rs.5.16 the previous Friday. This contrasted with the Sensex’s modest gain of 0.39% during the same period, signalling underperformance amid a backdrop of mixed financial updates and valuation recalibrations. The week was marked by a downgrade in the company’s investment rating and a notable shift in valuation metrics, reflecting cautious investor sentiment despite strong quarterly results. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: Axis Bank Gains 2.58%: 5 Key Factors Driving the Week’s Momentum
item.description: Axis Bank Ltd. delivered a solid weekly performance, rising 2.58% from Rs.1,333.80 to Rs.1,368.25 between 16 and 20 February 2026, comfortably outperforming the Sensex’s modest 0.39% gain. The week was marked by robust trading volumes, significant institutional interest, and a series of surges in derivatives open interest, signalling growing market conviction amid a cautiously optimistic backdrop for the private sector banking heavyweight. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: Rana Sugars Ltd Stagnates at Rs.11.05: 2 Key Downgrades Shape the Week
item.description: Rana Sugars Ltd ended the week flat at Rs.11.05, despite a series of significant developments including a downgrade to Strong Sell by MarketsMOJO amid deteriorating financial and quality metrics. The stock marginally outperformed the Sensex, which gained 0.39% over the same period, as the company grappled with declining profitability, rising interest costs, and subdued market sentiment. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: KCL Infra Projects Ltd Gains 10.40%: 2 Key Factors Driving the Surge
item.description: KCL Infra Projects Ltd delivered a strong weekly performance, rising 10.40% from ₹1.25 to ₹1.38, significantly outperforming the Sensex’s modest 0.39% gain over the same period. This surge was driven by a positive financial turnaround reported midweek and a notable shift in valuation metrics that enhanced the stock’s price appeal despite ongoing operational challenges. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: Steel Exchange India Ltd Falls 3.38%: Downgrade and Bearish Signals Weigh on Stock
item.description: Steel Exchange India Ltd experienced a challenging week from 16 to 20 February 2026, with its share price declining 3.38% to close at Rs.7.71, underperforming the Sensex which gained 0.39% over the same period. The stock faced pressure amid a downgrade to a Strong Sell rating driven by deteriorating financial quality and bearish technical signals, reflecting heightened risks for investors in the current market environment. Time: 1 hour ago

item.title: Vistar Amar Ltd Surges 89.77% in Five Days: 6 Key Factors Driving the Rally
item.description: Vistar Amar Ltd delivered a spectacular weekly performance from 16 to 20 February 2026, surging 89.77% from Rs.105.05 to Rs.199.35, vastly outperforming the Sensex’s modest 0.39% gain. The stock hit multiple 52-week highs during the week, reflecting strong momentum driven by robust financial results, technical upgrades, and shifting valuation perceptions amid a mixed broader market backdrop. item.title: Karur Vysya Bank Gains 2.17%: 2 Key Milestones Drive Weekly Momentum
item.description: Karur Vysya Bank Ltd. closed the week ending 20 Feb 2026 with a solid gain of 2.17%, outperforming the Sensex’s modest 0.39% rise. The stock’s performance was propelled by a new 52-week high and an all-time high reached midweek, reflecting strong investor confidence amid robust fundamentals and sustained earnings growth. Time: 2 hours ago
